# ion-loading-controller

Loading controllers programmatically control the loading component. Loadings can be created and dismissed from the loading controller. View the [Loading](../loading) documentation for a full list of options to pass upon creation.
docs: Loading controllers programmatically control the loading component. Loadings can be created and dismissed from the loading controller. View the [Loading](../loading) documentation for a full list of options to pass upon creation.

methods.name: create
methods.docs: Create a loading overlay with loading options.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: options The options to use to create the loading.

methods.name: dismiss
methods.signature: dismiss(data?: any, role?: string | undefined, id?: string | undefined) => Promise<boolean>

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: data Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text:
role The role of the element that is dismissing the loading.
This can be useful in a button handler for determining which button was
clicked to dismiss the loading.
Some examples include: ``"cancel"`, `"destructive"`, "selected"`, and `"backdrop"`.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: id The id of the loading to dismiss. If an id is not provided, it will dismiss the most recently opened loading.

methods.name: getTop
methods.docs: Get the most recently opened loading overlay.
